usa: First inauguration of George W. Bush: George W. Bush was inaugurated the forty-third President of the United States.[1]
The Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 was signed into law by President George W. Bush.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference">[2]</sup>
Timothy McVeigh is executed as an American domestic terrorist for the detonation of a truck bomb in front of the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City on April 19, 1995.[3]

September 11 terrorist attacks: Nineteen terrorists hijacked four planes and crashed them into the World Trade Center in New York City, the Pentagon in Arlington County, Virginia, and an open field near Shanksville, Pennsylvania, killing 2,996 people and injuring over 6,000. Flight 93 was about to make a crash in Washington, D.C., but the passengers fought the terrorists until the plane crashed into the field.[4]
2001 Anthrax attacks: Anthrax attacks killed five and infected seventeen more through the mail system.[5]
War in Afghanistan: The United States launched an invasion of Afghanistan.[6]
The USA PATRIOT Act, increasing law enforcement agencies' ability to conduct searches in cases of suspected terrorism, was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference">[7]</sup>
American Airlines Flight 587: A flight crashed in Queens, New York, killing 265.[8]
